parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A witness (judicially) or figuratively (genitive case); by analogy, a 'martyr'.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Religiously, piously. Adverb from hosios; piously.
Justly, righteously. Adverb from dikaios; equitably.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
